frequency noun
(LIGHT/SOUND/RADIO)
[ U ]
  physics
  specialized the number of times that a wave, especially a light, sound, or radio wave, is produced within a particular period, especially one second: the frequency of light low frequency radiation The human ear cannot hear very high-frequency sounds.
[ C ]
  media
  specialized a particular number of radio waves produced in a second at which a radio signal is broadcast: Do you know what frequency the BBC World Service is on?
